intro: Dominia acroptera, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cooler climates. Its flowers, which bloom in the spring, are small and white, often appearing in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dominia acroptera is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
